name: tippop-vscode
description: Show custom text in the VSCode status bar

default: $(smiley) Hello World!
$(code) "Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute." – Harold Abelson
$(book) "Talk is cheap. Show me the code." – Linus Torvalds
$(rocket) "First, solve the problem. Then, write the code." – John Johnson
$(smiley) "Simplicity is the soul of efficiency." – Austin Freeman
$(flame) "Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand." – Martin Fowler
$(zap) "Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable." – Ralph Johnson
$(beaker) "The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language." – Alan Kay
$(gear) "The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner." – Jim Highsmith
$(check) "Deleted code is debugged code." – Jeff Sickel
$(bug) "If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in." – Edsger Dijkstra
$(light-bulb) "The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it." – Dennis Ritchie
$(terminal) "Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code." – Dan Salomon
$(smiley) "Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out." – Chris Pine
$(rocket) "The sooner you start to code, the longer the program will take." – Roy Carlson
$(flame) "Premature optimization is the root of all evil." – Donald Knuth
$(zap) "Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen." – Edward V. Berard
$(book) "Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight." – Bill Gates
$(gear) "The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user." – C.A.R. Hoare
$(beaker) "The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state." – J. Osterhout
$(smiley) "Programming is the art of telling another human what one wants the computer to do." – Donald Knuth
$(rocket) "Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming." – Brian Kernighan
$(flame) "The function of good software is to make the complex appear simple." – Grady Booch
$(zap) "Good code is its own best documentation." – Steve McConnell
$(book) "The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren’t there." – Gordon Bell
$(gear) "The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late." – Seymour Cray
$(bug) "The best error message is the one that never shows up." – Thomas Fuchs
$(check) "The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought, coupled with judiciously placed print statements." – Brian Kernighan
$(light-bulb) "The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it." – Pamela Zave
$(terminal) "The best programs are written so that computing machines can perform them quickly and so that human beings can understand them clearly." – Donald Knuth
$(smiley) "The key to performance is elegance, not battalions of special cases." – Jon Bentley
$(rocket) "The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit." – Anonymous
$(flame) "The best code is no code at all." – Jeff Atwood
$(zap) "The best design is the simplest one that works." – Albert Einstein (adapted)
$(book) "The best way to predict the future is to invent it." – Alan Kay
$(gear) "The best way to get the right answer on the internet is not to ask a question; it’s to post the wrong answer." – Cunningham’s Law
$(beaker) "The best way to learn is to teach." – Frank Oppenheimer
$(smiley) "The best way to write secure code is not to write code at all." – Bruce Schneier
$(rocket) "The best way to write maintainable code is to write less code." – Sandi Metz
$(flame) "The best way to write fast code is to keep it simple." – Rob Pike
$(zap) "The best way to write reliable code is to write tests." – Kent Beck
$(book) "The best way to write reusable code is to write code that is easy to understand." – Robert C. Martin
$(gear) "The best way to write scalable code is to write code that is easy to change." – Martin Fowler
$(beaker) "The best way to write efficient code is to write correct code." – Bjarne Stroustrup
$(smiley) "The best way to write beautiful code is to write code that works." – Donald Knuth
$(rocket) "The best way to write elegant code is to write code that is simple." – Edsger Dijkstra
$(flame) "The best way to write robust code is to write code that is easy to test." – Kent Beck
$(zap) "The best way to write flexible code is to write code that is easy to extend." – Grady Booch
$(book) "The best way to write portable code is to write code that is standard." – Brian Kernighan
statusText.messages.description: Status bar random text pool, supports VSCode Codicon icons (e.g. $(flame))
